edu.first.util

Class TextFiles

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.first.util.TextFiles

  • public final class TextFiles
extends java.lang.Object
    A set of utility methods to manipulate text files. Behavior of IO is documented in Javadocs.
    Since:
    May 14 13

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void appendToFile(java.lang.String fileName, java.lang.String msg)
      Writes the text at the very end of the file.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • getTextFromFile

        public static java.lang.String getTextFromFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        Returns the text that is currently in a text file. Does not assume ".txt" ending, so file type must be added manually. All IO error are caught and logged inside of this method, as they are assumed to be things that are unaccountable for (hardware issues). If an IO error occurs, this method returns null. That is the only occasion that this method will return null, so it is safe to assume that null means an error occurred.
        Parameters:
        fileName - file name from the root directory in the cRIO
        Returns:
        contents of that file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when file does not exist
        java.lang.NullPointerException - when file name is null

      • writeAsFile

        public static void writeAsFile(java.lang.String fileName,
               java.lang.String msg)
        Writes the text as the full text file. Everything else is deleted.
        Parameters:
        fileName - file name from the root directory in the cRIO
        msg - text to set the file to

      • appendToFile

        public static void appendToFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                java.lang.String msg)
        Writes the text at the very end of the file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - file name from the root directory in the cRIO
        msg - text to add to the end of the file

      • appendToNewLine

        public static void appendToNewLine(java.lang.String fileName,
                   java.lang.String msg)
        Writes the text to a new line at the end of the file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - file name from the root directory in the cRIO
        msg - text to add to the end of the file
